intro: Triumfetta bradshawii, commonly known as the Bradshaw's triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lobed leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. The seeds are encased in a hairy, triangular capsule that splits open when mature.
